fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 4 : Assurer l'accès de tous à une éducation de qualité, sur un pied d'égalité, et à promouvoir les possibilités d'apprentissage tout au long de la vie.
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 4.1 : D’ici à 2030, faire en sorte que toutes les filles et tous les garçons suivent, sur un pied d’égalité, un cycle complet d’enseignement primaire et secondaire gratuit et de qualité, les dotant d’acquis véritablement utiles.
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 4.1.2 : Niveau de scolarité de la population âgée de 25 à 64 ans, selon le groupe d'âge et le sexe
fr.REC_USE_LIM: Ce tableau de données provient de la publication Indicateurs de l'éducation au Canada : Programme d'indicateurs pancanadiens de l'éducation, section D6 : Niveau de scolarité de la population âgée de 25 à 64 ans. Pour obtenir une brève description de cet indicateur, incluant la méthodologie, veuillez consulter le Manuel pour le Programme d'indicateurs pancanadiens de l'éducation.
fr.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Objectif 4 : Assurer l'accès de tous à une éducation de qualité, sur un pied d'égalité, et à promouvoir les possibilités d'apprentissage tout au long de la vie.
fr.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Cible 4.1 : D’ici à 2030, faire en sorte que toutes les filles et tous les garçons suivent, sur un pied d’égalité, un cycle complet d’enseignement primaire et secondaire gratuit et de qualité, les dotant d’acquis véritablement utiles.
fr.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicateur 4.1.2 : Taux d’achèvement (enseignement primaire, premier et deuxième cycles de l’enseignement secondaire).

fr.goal_meta_link_text: Métadonnées des objectifs de développement durable des Nations Unies

SDG_GOAL: Goal 4: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
SDG_TARGET: Target 4.1: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 4.1.2: Educational attainment of the population aged 25 to 64, by age group and sex
STAT_CONC_DEF:
Definition:
Percentage of a cohort of children or young people aged 3-5 years above the intended age for the last grade of each level of education who have completed that grade.

Concepts:
The intended age for the last grade of each level of education is the age at which pupils would enter the grade if they had started school at the official primary entrance age, had studied full-time and had progressed without repeating or skipping a grade. For example, if the official age of entry into primary education is 6 years, and if primary education has 6 grades, the intended age for the last grade of primary education is 11 years. In this case, 14-16 years (11 + 3 = 14 and 11 + 5 = 16) would be the reference age group for calculation of the primary completion rate.
DATA_COMP: Data were readily available to report for this indicator as specified by the metadata. Please refer to the sources to access additional information on the metadata or source.
REC_USE_LIM:
'High school graduation rate is calculated from Secondary 3 to Secondary 5 in Quebec, and Grades 10-12 in all other provinces. On-time graduation rate is the percentage of a cohort of young people who complete their high school studies within three years of starting Grade 10 (“Secondary 3” in Quebec). On-time graduation rate reflects the cohort entering Grade 10 ("Secondary 3" in Quebec) two school years prior to the reference year. For example, the data for reference year 2016/2017 represents the cohort entering Grade 10 ("Secondary 3" in Quebec) in 2014/2015.

High school graduation rate is calculated from Secondary 3 to Secondary 5 in Quebec, and Grades 10-12 in all other provinces. The true-cohort methodology uses two cohorts of students that begin in Grade 10 ("Secondary 3" in Quebec) to calculate the high school graduation rate (see Indicator C3 for more details).

Comparisons of high school graduation rates between provinces and territories require a nuanced interpretation as academic pathways, pass marks, subject requirements and the groups of students under consideration may differ from one province or territory to another. International students are also included in the graduation cohort, which could impact comparing graduation rates, as the proportion of international students varies across provinces.

Graduation rates reported here may differ to what is reported at the provincial/territorial-level due to varying methodologies for the calculation of graduation rates by individual provinces and territories.'
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 4: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 4.1: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 4.1.2: Completion rate (primary education, lower secondary education, upper secondary education)
